attributes.additional_details:
Bigger hospital to cater for citizens of Milton Keynes

No temporary structures but well-constructed building

Better facilities in wards

A&E unit to be renewed and widened. It was built in the 1980s to cater for 20K patients a year but currently being used by 73K patients.

Milton Keynes has been rapidly expanding and there is a major Western expansion planned which includes 6.5K new homes. The health service as well as the infrastructure has to be adjusted to cope with the growing population. Failure to do so will mean health of the citizens might be at risks.
